mem-label.tooltip: Enter custom text to show in the panel.

frequency.tooltip: Determines how often the applet checks RAM usage data from the system.

show-mode.tooltip: Choose whether to monitor used memory or remaining available memory.

show-value.tooltip: Toggle whether to display actual memory amount on the panel.

show-total.tooltip: Toggle whether to display total RAM capacity next to the current usage.

show-percent.tooltip: Toggle whether to display memory usage as a percentage.

unit-type.tooltip: Toggle whether to display memory usage in GB/GiB.

use-monospace.tooltip: Forces a fixed-width font and prevents text jumping.

padding-size.tooltip: How many characters to reserve for numbers (e.g. 4 for '99.9').

warning-usage.tooltip: Triggers a blinking visual alert when RAM usage exceeds this percentage.

warning-available.tooltip: Triggers a blinking visual alert when available RAM falls below this percentage.

enable-click-launch.tooltip: Left-clicking the applet will open the default system monitor.

custom-command.tooltip: Enter the command to be executed (e.g., gnome-system-monitor or xterm -e htop).
